Package jpanels

Class BasicView

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • jpanels.BasicView
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible
    public abstract class BasicView
extends javax.swing.JPanel
    Abstract class that extends the JPanel.

    Basically the JPanel is a container for everything we want to place into the window. Inside the JFrame.
    This class creates a Canvas3D, a SimpleUniverse, and a content branch.

    Implementing

    Subclass this, overriding the createContent() method and adding whatever else you want.
    Then, pass this into a Window constructor to use it. Look through the jpanels package.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • createContent

        public abstract org.jogamp.java3d.BranchGroup createContent()

        Note: This gets called before your subclass's contructor does.
        Returns:
        The BranchGroup containing the main scene content
